author: Anonymous Poet
title: When to consider cycles
question: Do we consider cycles and joins (and take care of them) only in graphs, or do cycles also occur in trees and lists?
instructor_answer: Fundamentally, if you have a cycle or join, the statement "while traversing this data normally, there are two ways to get to this same piece of the data" is true (either the piece of data reappears during a particular path (for cycles), or the piece of data appears on two distinct paths (for joins)). Is it possible to encounter this situation in a tree or a list?
